meanings.definition: A person or thing that causes extreme difficulty or frustration.
meanings.sent1: Dealing with that math problem was a real ballbusters for me.
meanings.sent2: She's a real ballbusters when it comes to meeting deadlines.
meanings.sent3: Trying to untangle the knots in my necklace was a real ballbusters!
meanings.sent4: The traffic jam was a ballbusters, making everyone late for work.
meanings.sent5: The final level of the game was a true ballbusters, testing my skills to the limit.

meanings.definition: A person who is very demanding or aggressive.
meanings.sent1: My boss can be a real ballbusters when it comes to perfection.
meanings.sent2: The coach is known to be a ballbusters during practice sessions.
meanings.sent3: The little dog acted like a ballbusters, demanding attention all the time.
meanings.sent4: She's a ballbusters in negotiations, always pushing for the best deal.
meanings.sent5: The teacher was a ballbusters, expecting nothing but the best from her students.

meanings.definition: A situation or task that is very challenging or difficult.
meanings.sent1: The obstacle course was a real ballbusters for the participants.
meanings.sent2: Completing the project on time was a ballbusters for the team.
meanings.sent3: Trying to fix the broken computer was a ballbusters, but I managed to do it.
meanings.sent4: The mountain hike was a ballbusters, but the view from the top was worth it.
meanings.sent5: Learning a new language can be a ballbusters, but it's rewarding in the end.
